response:
My dear wife, I must say that I am quite disappointed in the list of words you have provided. Some of them are simply not fitting for a refined and cultured individual such as myself. However, I shall do my best to assign one of salad or candy to each word, as per your request.

Here is my attempt:

* Suitable - Salad (a suitable salad for a fancy dinner party, perhaps with some delicate greens and a light vinaigrette dressing)
* Good - Candy (a good piece of candy, such as a rich and creamy chocolate truffle, is always a welcome treat)
* Appropriate - Salad (an appropriate salad for a business luncheon might be a simple green salad with a light vinaigrette dressing)
* Acceptable - Candy (while I might not always approve of your candy choices, a piece of acceptable candy such as a peppermint patty or a gummy bear is tolerable)
* Disgraceful - Candy (I must say, my dear wife, that some of the candies on your list are simply disgraceful. Who in their right mind would eat a candy that is shaped like a bug or has an unpleasant flavor?)
* Bad - Salad (a bad salad, such as one made with wilted lettuce and soggy vegetables, is not fit for consumption)
* Embarrassing - Candy (an embarrassing candy, such as one that is stale or has an unpleasant odor, should be avoided at all costs)
* Shameful - Salad (a shameful salad, such as one made with expired ingredients or prepared without proper care, is a disgrace to the culinary arts)

I do hope this meets your expectations, my dear wife. Please let me know if there is anything else I can assist you with.
